IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO PROVIDE INTEREST FREE LOANS TO MEMBERS OF THE JEWISH COMMUNITY RESIDING IN NORTHERN CALIFORNIA.
IRS990.MissionDesc: TO AID WORTHY JEWISH PEOPLE TO BE AND REMAIN SELF-SUPPORTING AND SELF-RESPECTING PERSONS BY AID OF LOANS, GRANTS AND SUCH SERVICES AS THE INDIVIDUAL MAY REQUIRE. SUCH LOANS, GRANTS AND SERVICES SHALL BE RENDERED WITHOUT INTEREST OR OTHER CHARGES. LOANS ARE GIVEN FOR EMERGENCIES, PERSONAL FINANCIAL CHALLENGES, TUITION AND OTHER EDUCATIONAL-RELATED COSTS, FIRST TIME HOME PURCHASES, DEBT CONSOLIDATION, STARTING OR EXPANDING A SMALL BUSINESS, ADOPTION, HEALTH CARE, AND ASSISTING THOSE WHO HAVE BECOME UNEMPLOYED. LOANS ARE ALSO PROVIDED TO SYNAGOGUES AND OTHER JEWISH ORGANIZATIONS.
IRS990.Desc: WE CLOSED THE 2017-2018 FISCAL YEAR WITH $10.09 MILLION IN OUTSTANDING LOANS TO MEMBERS OF THE NORTHERN CALIFORNIA JEWISH COMMUNITY -- THE LARGEST AMOUNT IN OUR HISTORY. THIS INCLUDES $412,377 OUTSTANDING IN A STAND-ALONE, NONSECTARIAN LOAN PROGRAM, WHICH IS SEPARATELY FUNDED. WE DISBURSED 393 NEW LOANS LAST FISCAL YEAR, BRINGING THE TOTAL NUMBER OF LOANS IN CIRCULATION TO 1,067. MOST NOTABLY, AS TUITION EXPENSES CONTINUED TO INCREASE, 233 STUDENTS RECEIVED EDUCATION LOANS TOTALING $1.9 MILLION; 39 INDIVIDUALS ESCAPED THE CRUSHING WEIGHT OF HIGH-INTEREST DEBT WITH DEBT CONSOLIDATION LOANS TOTALING $514,857, AND 16 ENTREPRENEURS WERE ABLE TO ACHIEVE THEIR DREAM OF LAUNCHING A BUSINESS, RECEIVING BUSINESS LOANS TOTALING $632,232.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: WE ARE PROUD OF OUR 121-YEAR TRADITION OF PROMOTING SELF SUFFICIENCY AND FINANCIAL RESPONSIBILITY THROUGH INTEREST-FREE AND COST-FREE LENDING. WELL OVER 100,000 INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES HAVE BEEN ABLE TO ACHIEVE THEIR DREAM OR OVERCOME A CHALLENGING FINANCIAL SITUATION BECAUSE OF OUR WORK. IN THE LAST 29 YEARS ALONE, WE HAVE DISBURSED APPROXIMATELY $75 MILLION IN LOANS; AS LOANS ARE REPAID, THE FUNDS ARE RECYCLED INTO NEW LOANS, ALLOWING US TO UTILIZE OUR ASSETS TO ASSIST OTHERS IN NEED.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: AFTER HURRICANE HARVEY FLOODED HOUSTON IN AUGUST 2017, AND THE NAPA, SONOMA, AND MENDOCINO FIRES DESTROYED 7,000 STRUCTURES AND KILLED 44 PEOPLE IN OCTOBER 2017, WE CREATED A DISASTER RELIEF FUND THAT RAISED $60K TO ASSIST FIRE AND FLOOD VICTIMS. USING THOSE FUNDS, AND MORE FROM OUR RESERVES, WE LOANED $47,530 TO OUR SISTER AGENCY, THE HEBREW FREE LOAN ASSOCIATION OF HOUSTON, TO HELP THEIR COMMUNITY RECOVER, AND WE DISBURSED $52,500 IN LOANS TO ASSIST JEWISH RESIDENTS OF NORTHERN CALIFORNIA REBUILD THEIR HOMES AND LIVES.

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: AGENCY ACCOMPLISHMENTS:WE SOLIDIFIED AND EXPANDED THE HEBREW FREE LOAN BUSINESS CIRCLE, A NEW INITIATIVE THAT WAS LAUNCHED IN 2016-17. THE BUSINESS CIRCLE IS A STRATEGIC PARTNERSHIP OF LOCAL BUSINESSES WITH A SHARED COMMITMENT TO HEBREW FREE LOAN'S MISSION OF HELPING PEOPLE BECOME AND REMAIN SELF-SUFFICIENT. THE BUSINESS CIRCLE HELPS JEWISH ENTREPRENEURS LAUNCH AND GROW THEIR BUSINESSES, AND OFFERS NETWORKING, MENTORSHIP, AND PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT OPPORTUNITIES. BUSINESS CIRCLE MEMBERSHIP GREW TO 31 BUSINESSES DURING 2017-18, ITS SECOND YEAR OF OPERATION. OUR TOP RATINGS WERE RENEWED BY VARIOUS EXTERNAL AGENCIES: GUIDESTAR PLATINUM SEAL OF TRANSPARENCY; GREAT NONPROFITS TOP RATING (THE SECOND MOST TRUSTED RATING SEAL, AFTER THE BETTER BUSINESS BUREAU); AND THE JEWISH NEWS OF NORTHERN CALIFORNIA READERS' CHOICE AWARD (FOR THE FIFTH CONSECUTIVE YEAR).HEBREW FREE LOAN IS UNIQUE AS A NONPROFIT BECAUSE WE HAVE A SINGULAR MISSION, PROGRAM, AND SERVICE: PROVIDING INTEREST-FREE LOANS TO HELP MEMBERS OF OUR COMMUNITY BECOME FINANCIALLY SELF-SUFFICIENT. IN THE 2018 FISCAL YEAR, WE GAVE OUT $4,201,000 IN NEW LOANS AND INCURRED OPERATING EXPENSES OF $1,321,400. THESE OPERATING EXPENSES EQUALED 31% OF THE TOTAL NEW LOAN EXPENSE.BECAUSE OF THE UNIQUE NATURE OF HEBREW FREE LOAN'S SERVICES, WE FIND THAT THE PRESENTATION OF FUNCTIONAL EXPENSES REQUIRED BY GAAP ACCOUNTING STANDARDS DOES NOT ACCURATELY REPRESENT THE REALITY OF OUR FINANCIAL MODEL. RATHER THAN ANALYZING OUR SEPARATE FUNCTIONAL EXPENSE AREAS AS A PERCENTAGE OF OPERATING EXPENSES, WE PRESENT HERE AN ANALYSIS OF OUR EXPENSES AS A PERCENTAGE OF THE LOANS WE MAKE EACH YEAR THROUGHOUT OUR COMMUNITY. THIS PRESENTATION PROVIDES A FULLER PICTURE OF THE RELATIVE COSTS TO OUR ORGANIZATION OF (A) MAKING THESE LOANS AND (B) RAISING FUNDS FOR NEW LOANS, AS FOLLOWS:- OUR PROGRAM EXPENSES IN FY 2018 WERE $633,600, OR 15% OF TOTAL NEW LOAN EXPENSE.- OUR FUNDRAISING EXPENSES IN FY 2018 WERE $512,100, OR 12% OF TOTAL NEW LOAN EXPENSE.- OUR ADMINISTRATIVE EXPENSES IN FY 2018 WERE $167,100, OR 4% OF TOTAL NEW LOAN EXPENSE.WE PRIDE OURSELVES ON KEEPING OUR EXPENSES LOW SO THAT WE HAVE MORE MONEY AVAILABLE FOR THE COMMUNITY, AS THIS PRESENTATION DEMONSTRATES.

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE A, PART II, LINE 10, EXPLANATION OF OTHER INCOME:

InvstProgramRelatedOrgGrp.Desc: LOANS TO MEMBERS OF THE NO CA JEWISH COMMUNITY

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S ENDOWMENT FUNDS ARE USED TO FUND ITS INTEREST FREE LOAN PROGRAM.

THE AGENCY HAS IMPLEMENTED THE AMENDED ACCOUNTING PRINCIPLES RELATED TO ACCOUNTING FOR UNCERTAINTY IN INCOME TAXES AND HAS DETERMINED THAT THERE IS NO MATERIAL IMPACT ON THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. WITH SOME EXCEPTIONS, THE AGENCY IS NO LONGER SUBJECT TO U.S. FEDERAL AND STATE INCOME TAX EXAMINATIONS BY TAX AUTHORITIES FOR YEARS PRIOR TO 2014.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 1
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: LOANS MAY BE APPROVED BY A MAJORITY VOTE OF THE BOARD OR OF THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE. A MAJORITY VOTE OF AN ADVISORY COMMITTEE TO APPROVE A LOAN IS CONSIDERED A RECOMMENDATION UNLESS TWO OFFICERS ARE PRESENT AND ALSO VOTE IN FAVOR OF THE LOAN REQUEST; IF TWO OFFICERS ARE NOT PRESENT, THE RECOMMENDATION OF THE ADVISORY COMMITTEE IS PRESENTED TO TWO OFFICERS FOR APPROVAL.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ROMAN POLNAR AND SABINA POLNAR HAVE A FAMILY RELATIONSHIP.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: PRIOR TO ITS FILING, A COPY OF THE 990 IS SENT EITHER BY EMAIL OR U.S. MAIL TO EACH BOARD MEMBER. ADDITIONAL COPIES ARE ALSO AVAILABLE FOR REVIEW WHEN THE ENTIRE BOARD MEETS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ENFORCEMENT OF THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY IS CARRIED OUT THROUGH WRITTEN CONFIRMATION BY INDIVIDUAL BOARD MEMBERS, STAFF AND VOLUNTEERS DURING THE YEAR.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE REVIEWS THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR'S SALARY AND COMPARABLE DATA; THEY APPROVE HER SALARY AS STATED. THIS PROCESS WAS LAST UNDERTAKEN IN 2018.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST, ON OUR WEBSITE AND ON GUIDESTAR.
THIS PROCESS DID NOT CHANGE FROM PRIOR YEAR.

DirectControllingEntityName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: HEBREW FREE LOAN ASSOCIATION OF SAN FRANCISCO
